translations: n．庭院（复数）：一个被建筑物或墙壁围绕的开放空地，通常用于户外活动或装饰。
· The hotel has several beautiful courtyards.
这家酒店有几个美丽的庭院。

sentences.sentence: Tourists will be surprised by the spacious and well-built courtyards among the houses everywhere they go.
sentences.translation: 无数宽敞美丽的庭院藏身于屋舍之间，游客们每到一处都有会惊喜的发现。

sentences.sentence: It was a close-knit community of rectangular, one-story mud-brick houses, joined by narrow lanes and courtyards, finally abandoned about 5000 B.C.
sentences.translation: 它是一座结构紧凑的村庄，有着与狭窄小道和院子相连的矩形单层泥砖房屋，这座村庄最终于公元前5000年被废弃。

sentences.sentence: This fact, and the careful, solitary placement of the kiva in the center of the mission complex courtyards, suggests an intention to highlight the importance of the kiva rather than to diminish it.
sentences.translation: 这一事实，以及将（普埃布洛印第安人庆祝用的）地下礼堂小心翼翼地单独放置在传教士建筑群庭院的中心，表明了突出这个地下礼堂的重要性，而不是贬低它的意图。
